title: Lula’s Party Backs Central Bank Chief Despite High Interest Rate
description: The head of Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s political party expressed support for central bank chief Gabriel Galipolo, even as high interest rates threaten to drag on the economy ahead of next year’s election.
fullText: MarketsBy Daniel Carvalho and Martha Viotti BeckSaveThe head of Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s political party expressed support for central bank chief Gabriel Galipolo, even as high interest rates threaten to drag on the economy ahead of next year’s election.With the benchmark Selic at a nearly two-decade high of 15%, most members of the leftist Workers’ Party believe it’s time to “enter a cycle of interest rate cuts,” Edinho Silva told reporters in Brasilia on Tuesday. Still, Silva praised Galipolo, who Lula appointed to lead the bank starting this year.

title: France’s Bid for Welfare Budget Gets Boost as Greens to Abstain
description: French lawmakers in the Green group at the National Assembly will abstain in a crucial vote on the social security budget, increasing the likelihood Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu can avoid a government crisis.
fullText: PoliticsBy William HorobinSaveFrench lawmakers in the Green group at the National Assembly will abstain in a crucial vote on the social security budget, increasing the likelihood Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu can avoid a government crisis. The Ecologie et Social group only has 38 of the 577 seats in the lower house, but their abstentions could be enough to swing a tight vote later Tuesday.

title: From Jail, Bolsonaro Hits Hedge-Fund Trade That Swept Brazil
description: As Brazil’s markets rallied, month after month, and global investors kept flooding in, the gains were big enough to overshadow the risks from a presidential election that’s still almost a year away.
fullText:
MarketsBy Giovanna Bellotti Azevedo, Vinicius Andrade, and Leda AlvimSaveLea en español
Leia em portuguêsAs Brazil’s markets rallied, month after month, and global investors kept flooding in, the gains were big enough to overshadow the risks from a presidential election that’s still almost a year away.

title: Treasuries Rally Stalls as Job Openings Highlight Fed’s Dilemma
description: Treasuries edged lower after a gauge of US job openings topped estimates, highlighting the challenge Federal Reserve policymakers face as they prepare to vote on whether to lower interest rates again this week.
fullText: MarketsBy Elizabeth Stanton and Michael MacKenzieSaveTreasuries edged lower after a gauge of US job openings topped estimates, highlighting the challenge Federal Reserve policymakers face as they prepare to vote on whether to lower interest rates again this week.Yields rebounded from session lows reached during US morning after Labor Department data showed October job openings increased to the highest level in five months. While traders continue to almost fully price in a quarter-point rate cut by the Fed on Wednesday, the central bank’s two previous cuts this year were intended to address weakening employment conditions, including a rise in the unemployment rate to nearly 4.5%.

title: NJ’s Montclair Cuts School Staff and Mulls March Tax-Hike Vote
description: The wealthy New Jersey commuter town of Montclair is moving forward with staff and program cuts at its public schools as part of the system’s efforts to address a nearly $20 million budget gap.
fullText: CityLabBy Erin HudsonSaveThe wealthy New Jersey commuter town of Montclair is moving forward with staff and program cuts at its public schools as part of the system’s efforts to address a nearly $20 million budget gap. Principals across the Montclair Public Schools district sent messages via email and a parent portal on Friday outlining the plan, according to documents seen by Bloomberg. The changes, which will be in effect early next month, come after a judge ruled that a vote on increasing property taxes can’t go through this week as scheduled.

title: Netflix CEO brushes aside Paramount’s ‘entirely expected’ hostile bid, ‘super confident’ of closing deal with Warner Bros. Discovery
description: The Netflix Co-CEO also said he's talked with the president "many times" since the election and he'll be good to movie theaters once he’s running a studio.
